data.title: ModelMesh.Tag ignored in ContentManager.Load<Model>()
data.body: Hello, ***I have started porting my existing game engine from Xna to MonoGame recently. The process goes well and MonoGame looks very good but I have faced some issues. I will create 1 bug per issue. MonoGame 3.3.0.2238 Issue 1: ModelMesh.Tag ignored in ContentManager.Load() I have custom model processor which uses Model.Tag, ModelMesh.Tag and ModelMeshPart.Tag properties to store custom data. In ContentMagager.Load(), Model.Tag and ModelMeshPart.Tag are loaded just fine but ModelMesh.Tag is simply ignored. Currently I use simple workaround storing ModelMesh.Tag data in the ModelMeshPart.Tag but honestly I do not see any point to ignore MedelMesh.Tag property and I think that is a bug. There are modelMeshPart.Tag = reader.ReadObject

data.title: Updated WinForms Pipeline with Add File Dialog, Folder Support and Better Context Menu Terminology
data.body: After you merge this, you can close #3292 and #3291

data.body: Small update for help docs.

data.title: KeyboardInput and MessageBox converted to static form
data.body: These classes intended to be static. They are partial but it is not a problem for combine static and partial in one place.

data.title: Bunch of small improvements and fixes for Gtk Pipeline
data.body:
Things done:
  • Changed "Monogame Pipeline" to "MonoGame Pipeline"
  • Fixed a bug where the Pipeline had a small chance of crashing upon calling buid/rebuild/clean
  • Output TextView now autoscrolls during compilation
  • Double clicking item in treeview now opens the default application for that item
  • Text dialog now checks entered characters to make sure they are characters than can be used for creating a directory
  • Some terminology improvements (#3292):
![file](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6773302/6760539/df65891e-cf49-11e4-9656-57caaa35a00c.png) ![folder](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6773302/6760540/df7edea0-cf49-11e4-90ca-e70851f8b437.png) ![main](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6773302/6760541/df7f33a0-cf49-11e4-9971-1b0b390798d3.png) PS. Next PR I will submit will bring WinForms Pipeline up to date

data.title: Audio compilation broken :(
data.body:
So I already know what caused this issue, it's this:
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/commit/0632ec611217985c2c4738b2f8f1777a056f0583

And to be even more precise, it's this line of code:

> loopLength = data.Count / ((bitsPerSample / 8) \* channelCount);

The error that occurs is this:

> Build started 3/20/2015 8:40:13 PM
> 
> /home/harry/Documents/songtest/Game01.mp3
> /home/harry/Documents/songtest/Game01.mp3: error: Processor 'SongProcessor' had unexpected failure!
> System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
>   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent.ConvertFormat (ConversionFormat formatType, ConversionQuality quality, System.String saveToFile) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
>   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.SongProcessor.Process (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
>   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessor`2[Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Audio.AudioContent,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.SongContent].Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentProcessor.Process (System.Object input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
>   at MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.ProcessContent (MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineBuildEvent pipelineEvent) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
> Build 0 succeeded, 1 failed.
> 
> Time elapsed 00:00:01.05.

data.title: AAC streams should have m4a extension
data.body: mp4 is the container format and is usually used for files containing video. m4a is used for files containing audio only.

data.title: BoundingFrustum docs
data.body:

-All public things are now documented
-All private fields are automatically renamed to private form with "_"(using resharper so it absolutly correct)
-Added Intersects overloads with rays(I dont know really how to get result differs from null and 0.0 so I leave this question opened). I also implemented few checks in Bounding.cs.
-PlaneCount is now opened const integer because why not ?
-ToString rewritted to more easy form.

data.title: Effect link exception
Loop length in XNB now matches XNA
data.body:
The XNB File Format document specifies the loop start and loop length are in bytes, but they are in samples.
Loop start and length are now populated in AudioContent when loading the sample data.
The loop start and loop length are no longer treated as bytes in XAudio playback.
XNA and MonoGame generated XNB files are now only different by one bit (1ms in duration).

Fixes #3507

data.title: Add visual test for SamplerState.ComparisonFunction
data.body: Related to #3628.

data.title: Graphics interfaces docs
data.body:
New docs for all Xna.Framework.Graphics interfaces.

I will release "inheritdocs" fixes for effects in next PR's..

data.title: BasicEffect leaks memory after Dispose() call
data.body:
If you create a lot of BasicEffects (1 at a time or in bulk) and then dispose them, there is pretty big memory leak. I've tried forcing GC.Collect() but it doesn't help. Somewhere, unmanaged memory is allocated but never released when you create BasicEffects.

A simple demo is here - it allocates and then destroys 100 BasicEffects per frame, then calls a full GC. On Windows DirectX, it leaks 5-10 mb per second.
https://gist.github.com/ala53/5aff5801b66fe4c55548

(This is on MonoGame 3.2)

data.title: Implement Joystick class/API
data.body: So the GamePad covers a way to access controllers that look like a xbox 360 controller. A Joystick class would allow access to any kind of controller, no matter the number of axis/buttons/hats, it would be on a lower level similar like the OpenTK joystick class operates.

data.title: Linux installer Update
data.body:
Things done:
  • Added gtk linux so libs
  • Added libstdc++6 to dependency list
  • Added a check for libstdc++6 that checks if it supports GLIBCXX_3.4.20, if it doesn't it will offer to install custom version of it

data.title: Replaced sdl1.2 with OpenTK for Joystick and Gamepad
data.body: #3407 looked too ugly... and I still have to learn how to rebase. Also this PR provides Gamepad class from #3119, but a little bit modified.

data.title: Added additional texture formats to PngWriter.GetColorData
data.body: Alpha8, Bgra5551, Rg32, Rgba64 and Rgba1010102, as per #3622

data.title: Pipeline now accepts uppercase extensions
data.body: Uppercase extensions foiled the importer auto-detect. File extension is now lower-cased for the detection process.

data.title: MediaPlayer.WMS now changes stream volume
data.body:
The previous iteration changed the application volume controller which affected all sound output including sound effects. It now uses the stream volume controller so it only affects the streaming media and sound effects remain unaffected.

Thanks to MarkoBL for the fix.

Fixes #2780

data.title: Implement comparison samplers for Direct3D and OpenGL
data.body:
Adds `SamplerState.ComparisonFunction`, and hooks it up for Direct3D and OpenGL.

I wasn't sure whether to call the new property `ComparisonFunction` or `CompareFunction` - I decided to go with the former, because that's how both Direct3D and OpenGL refer to it, even if it doesn't match the XNA / MG enum name.

Replaces #2088 (I'd have liked to cherry-pick those commits, but it was easier just to start from scratch).

This seems like a good use-case for `GraphicsProfile` - comparison samplers aren't supported by OpenGL ES 2.0 (without an extension), nor, I believe, Direct3D 11 feature level 9.x. We could throw an runtime exception if you try to use a comparison sampler. But I guess that is for the future - MG doesn't really use graphics profiles much yet, and whether it should or not is a whole separate discussion.

(This will conflict with my other PR, #3626 - I'll just do a rebase on whichever one isn't merged first.)

data.title: Use InvariantCulture when parsing output of ffprobe.
data.body:
It appears that ffprobe might always output en-US number styles.

Fixes #3620

data.title: Implement BorderColor texture address mode for Direct3D and OpenGL
data.body:
Fixes #1952.

@tomspilman wrote a helpful checklist in #1952, which I just went through and implemented:
- Add TextureAddressMode.Border enum value (at the end of the list).
- Add SamplerState.BorderColor property.
- Fix both the DX SamplerState.GetState() and the GL SamplerState.Activate() methods to generate a correct platform specific border color state.
- Add BorderColor sampler state parsing to 2MGFX.
- Increment the MGFX version, fix writer to write BorderColor sampler state into the file.
- Fix MGFX runtime code to read BorderColor sampler state.

data.title: Replace sdl mixer 1.2/openal with...
data.body:
So Linux uses sdl1.2 mixer which is deprecated and it should be replaced... 
WindoiwsGL uses OpenAL that loads an entire song instead of just buffering it...
So what would be a good replacement that is cross platform(Windows / Linux / Mac)?

data.title: Implement Render Metrics.
data.body:
This is a topic about implementing metrics system for MonoGame. Metrics should calculate GPU draw calls and other stuff. It must be simple and effecient in term of performance.
Here is a few points :

-The @KonajuGames suggest static class Metrics which could calculate GPU rendering calls and helps  developer to optimize his projects.
-My suggestion is Metrics for SpriteBatch which could calculate draw calls.

Discuss.

data.title: New docs
data.body:
This PR caps the all remained enums in Microsoft.XNA.Framework.Graphics namespace. 
Docs for :

-Blend
-BlendFunction
-BufferUsage
-ClearOptions
-ColorWriteChannels
-CompareFunction
-CubeMapFace
-CullMode

All docs are unique and not be equal to same in XNA. New tests for them in EnumConformingTest are implemented.

data.title: Added few missing PackedVectors and Tests for them.
data.body: #3605 @flibitijibibo is the one who wrote PackedVector classes, I've only modified documentation and added tests for them.

data.title: Unhandled Exception in Windows 8/8.1 when game begins running after build
data.body:
# Technical Specs

I'm running Windows 8.1, using Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 Update 4. Microsoft .NET Framework 4.5.1 is installed.
# Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a new Windows Store or Windows Universal 8.1 Project.
2. Build, Deploy and Run the Windows 8/8.1 project.
# What Happens

The sample template builds successfully, and shows the default splash screen for a few seconds. As soon as it finishes, the desktop appears with a Just In Time debugger window saying that a Microsoft .NET Framework exception occurred in the executable.

![exception1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6163825/6697117/592d6354-cce6-11e4-9fb2-00fd3a5fb751.PNG)

However the game still runs perfectly fine, and other platforms build without these issues. If you run a new VS2013 instance to handle the exception, it says that a class is not registered.

![exception2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6163825/6697116/592be074-cce6-11e4-8f07-5cfe119f04b2.PNG)

Here is Windows 8:
![exception3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6163825/6697118/592e41e8-cce6-11e4-8311-c70c49bd6ee7.PNG)

Also if you try to run the build outside Visual Studio, you have to run it twice in order to get past the splash screen.
